trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect sync: Generic SQL Connector step-by step | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect sync: Generic SQL Connector step-by step | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This article is walking you through a simple HR system step-by-step using the Generic SQL Connector.
trans-unit.target: This article is walking you through a simple HR system step-by-step using the Generic SQL Connector.

trans-unit.source: Generic SQL Connector step-by-step
trans-unit.target: Generic SQL Connector step-by-step

trans-unit.source: This topic is a step-by-step guide.
trans-unit.target: This topic is a step-by-step guide.

trans-unit.source: It will create a simple sample HR database and use it for importing some users and their group membership.
trans-unit.target: It will create a simple sample HR database and use it for importing some users and their group membership.

trans-unit.source: Prepare the sample database
trans-unit.target: Prepare the sample database

trans-unit.source: On a server running SQL Server, run the SQL script found in [Appendix A](#appendix-a). This will create a sample database with the name GSQLDEMO.
trans-unit.target: On a server running SQL Server, run the SQL script found in [Appendix A](#appendix-a). This will create a sample database with the name GSQLDEMO.

trans-unit.source: The object model for the created database will look like this:
trans-unit.target: The object model for the created database will look like this:

trans-unit.source: Object Model
trans-unit.target: Object Model

trans-unit.source: Also create a user you want to use to connect to the database.
trans-unit.target: Also create a user you want to use to connect to the database.

trans-unit.source: In this walkthrough the user is called FABRIKAM\SQLUser and located in the domain.
trans-unit.target: In this walkthrough the user is called FABRIKAM\SQLUser and located in the domain.

trans-unit.source: Create the ODBC connection file
trans-unit.target: Create the ODBC connection file

trans-unit.source: The Generic SQL Connector is using ODBC to connect to the remote server.
trans-unit.target: The Generic SQL Connector is using ODBC to connect to the remote server.

trans-unit.source: First we need to create a file with the ODBC connection information.
trans-unit.target: First we need to create a file with the ODBC connection information.

trans-unit.source: Start the ODBC management utility on your server:
trans-unit.target: Start the ODBC management utility on your server:

trans-unit.source: ODBC
trans-unit.target: ODBC

trans-unit.source: Select the tab **File DSN**.
trans-unit.target: Select the tab **File DSN**.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Add...**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Add...**.

trans-unit.source: ![ODBC1](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\odbc1.png)
trans-unit.target: ![ODBC1](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\odbc1.png)

trans-unit.source: The out-of-box driver will work fine, so select it and click **Next>**.
trans-unit.target: The out-of-box driver will work fine, so select it and click **Next>**.

trans-unit.source: ![ODBC2](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\odbc2.png)
trans-unit.target: ![ODBC2](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\odbc2.png)

trans-unit.source: Give the file a name, such as **GenericSQL**.
trans-unit.target: Give the file a name, such as **GenericSQL**.

trans-unit.source: ![ODBC3](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\odbc3.png)
trans-unit.target: ![ODBC3](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\odbc3.png)

trans-unit.source: Click on **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: ![ODBC4](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\odbc4.png)
trans-unit.target: ![ODBC4](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\odbc4.png)

trans-unit.source: Time to configure the connection.
trans-unit.target: Time to configure the connection.

trans-unit.source: Give the data source a good description and provide the name of the server running SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: Give the data source a good description and provide the name of the server running SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: ODBC5
trans-unit.target: ODBC5

trans-unit.source: Select how to authenticate with SQL.
trans-unit.target: Select how to authenticate with SQL.

trans-unit.source: In this case we will use Windows Authentication.
trans-unit.target: In this case we will use Windows Authentication.

trans-unit.source: ODBC6
trans-unit.target: ODBC6

trans-unit.source: Provide the name of the sample database, **GSQLDEMO**.
trans-unit.target: Provide the name of the sample database, **GSQLDEMO**.

trans-unit.source: ![ODBC7](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\odbc7.png)
trans-unit.target: ![ODBC7](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\odbc7.png)

trans-unit.source: Keep everything default on this screen.
trans-unit.target: Keep everything default on this screen.

trans-unit.source: Click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: ![ODBC8](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\odbc8.png)
trans-unit.target: ![ODBC8](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\odbc8.png)

trans-unit.source: To verify everything is working as expected, click on **Test Data Source**.
trans-unit.target: To verify everything is working as expected, click on **Test Data Source**.

trans-unit.source: ![ODBC9](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\odbc9.png)
trans-unit.target: ![ODBC9](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\odbc9.png)

trans-unit.source: Make sure the test is successful.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the test is successful.

trans-unit.source: ODBC10
trans-unit.target: ODBC10

trans-unit.source: The ODBC configuration file should now be visible in File DSN.
trans-unit.target: The ODBC configuration file should now be visible in File DSN.

trans-unit.source: ODBC11
trans-unit.target: ODBC11

trans-unit.source: We now have the file we need and can start creating the Connector.
trans-unit.target: We now have the file we need and can start creating the Connector.

trans-unit.source: Create the Generic SQL Connector
trans-unit.target: Create the Generic SQL Connector

trans-unit.source: In the Synchronization Service Manager UI, select **Connectors** and **Create**.
trans-unit.target: In the Synchronization Service Manager UI, select **Connectors** and **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Generic SQL (Microsoft)** and give it a descriptive name.
trans-unit.target: Select **Generic SQL (Microsoft)** and give it a descriptive name.

trans-unit.source: ![Connector1](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\connector1.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Connector1](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\connector1.png)

trans-unit.source: Find the DSN file you created in the previous section and upload it to the server.
trans-unit.target: Find the DSN file you created in the previous section and upload it to the server.

trans-unit.source: Provide the credentials to connect to the database.
trans-unit.target: Provide the credentials to connect to the database.

trans-unit.source: Connector2
trans-unit.target: Connector2

trans-unit.source: In this walkthrough we are making it easy for us and say that there are two object types, **User** and **Group**.
trans-unit.target: In this walkthrough we are making it easy for us and say that there are two object types, **User** and **Group**.

trans-unit.source: ![Connector3](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\connector3.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Connector3](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\connector3.png)

trans-unit.source: To find the attributes we want the Connector to detect those by looking at the table itself.
trans-unit.target: To find the attributes we want the Connector to detect those by looking at the table itself.

trans-unit.source: Since **Users** is a reserved word in SQL, we need to provide it in square brackets [ ].
trans-unit.target: Since **Users** is a reserved word in SQL, we need to provide it in square brackets [ ].

trans-unit.source: ![Connector4](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\connector4.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Connector4](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\connector4.png)

trans-unit.source: Time to define the anchor attribute and the DN attribute.
trans-unit.target: Time to define the anchor attribute and the DN attribute.

trans-unit.source: For **Users** we will use the combination of the two attributes username and EmployeeID.
trans-unit.target: For **Users** we will use the combination of the two attributes username and EmployeeID.

trans-unit.source: For **group** we will use GroupName (not very realistic in real-life, but for this walkthrough it works).
trans-unit.target: For **group** we will use GroupName (not very realistic in real-life, but for this walkthrough it works).

trans-unit.source: ![Connector5](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\connector5.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Connector5](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\connector5.png)

trans-unit.source: Not all attribute types can be detected in a SQL database.
trans-unit.target: Not all attribute types can be detected in a SQL database.

trans-unit.source: The reference attribute type in particular cannot.
trans-unit.target: The reference attribute type in particular cannot.

trans-unit.source: For the group object type, we need to change the OwnerID and MemberID to reference.
trans-unit.target: For the group object type, we need to change the OwnerID and MemberID to reference.

trans-unit.source: Connector6
trans-unit.target: Connector6

trans-unit.source: For the attributes we selected as reference attributes in the previous step now require the object type these are a reference to.
trans-unit.target: For the attributes we selected as reference attributes in the previous step now require the object type these are a reference to.

trans-unit.source: In our case these will be the User object type.
trans-unit.target: In our case these will be the User object type.

trans-unit.source: Connector7
trans-unit.target: Connector7

trans-unit.source: On the Global Parameters page, select **Watermark** as the delta strategy.
trans-unit.target: On the Global Parameters page, select **Watermark** as the delta strategy.

trans-unit.source: Also type in the date/time format **yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss**.
trans-unit.target: Also type in the date/time format **yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss**.

trans-unit.source: ![Connector8](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\connector8.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Connector8](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\connector8.png)

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure Partitions** page, select both object types.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure Partitions** page, select both object types.

trans-unit.source: ![Connector9](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\connector9.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Connector9](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\connector9.png)

trans-unit.source: On the **Select Object Types** and **Select Attributes**, select both object types and all attributes.
trans-unit.target: On the **Select Object Types** and **Select Attributes**, select both object types and all attributes.

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure Anchors** page, click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure Anchors** page, click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: Create Run Profiles
trans-unit.target: Create Run Profiles

trans-unit.source: In the Synchronization Service Manager UI, select **Connectors**, and **Configure Run Profiles**.
trans-unit.target: In the Synchronization Service Manager UI, select **Connectors**, and **Configure Run Profiles**.

trans-unit.source: Click on **New Profile**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **New Profile**.

trans-unit.source: We will start with **Full Import**.
trans-unit.target: We will start with **Full Import**.

trans-unit.source: ![Runprofile1](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\runprofile1.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Runprofile1](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\runprofile1.png)

trans-unit.source: Select the type **Full Import (Stage Only)**.
trans-unit.target: Select the type **Full Import (Stage Only)**.

trans-unit.source: ![Runprofile2](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\runprofile2.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Runprofile2](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\runprofile2.png)

trans-unit.source: Select the partition **OBJECT=User**.
trans-unit.target: Select the partition **OBJECT=User**.

trans-unit.source: ![Runprofile3](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\runprofile3.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Runprofile3](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\runprofile3.png)

trans-unit.source: Select **Table** and type **[USERS]**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Table** and type **[USERS]**.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down to the multi-valued object type section and enter the data as in below.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down to the multi-valued object type section and enter the data as in below.

trans-unit.source: Select **Finish** to save the step.
trans-unit.target: Select **Finish** to save the step.

trans-unit.source: ![Runprofile4a](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\runprofile4a.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Runprofile4a](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\runprofile4a.png)

trans-unit.source: ![Runprofile4b](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\runprofile4b.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Runprofile4b](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\runprofile4b.png)

trans-unit.source: Select **New Step**.
trans-unit.target: Select **New Step**.

trans-unit.source: This time, select **OBJECT=Group**.
trans-unit.target: This time, select **OBJECT=Group**.

trans-unit.source: On the last page, use the configuration below.
trans-unit.target: On the last page, use the configuration below.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: ![Runprofile5a](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\runprofile5a.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Runprofile5a](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\runprofile5a.png)

trans-unit.source: ![Runprofile5b](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\runprofile5b.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Runprofile5b](.\media\active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql-step-by-step\runprofile5b.png)

trans-unit.source: Optional: You can configure additional run profiles if you want to.
trans-unit.target: Optional: You can configure additional run profiles if you want to.

trans-unit.source: For this walkthrough only the Full Import is used.
trans-unit.target: For this walkthrough only the Full Import is used.

trans-unit.source: Click on **OK** to finish changing run profiles.
trans-unit.target: Click on **OK** to finish changing run profiles.

trans-unit.source: Add some test data and test the import
trans-unit.target: Add some test data and test the import

trans-unit.source: Fill out some test data in your sample database.
trans-unit.target: Fill out some test data in your sample database.

trans-unit.source: When you are ready, select **Run** and **Full import**.
trans-unit.target: When you are ready, select **Run** and **Full import**.

trans-unit.source: Here is a user with two phone numbers and a group with some members.
trans-unit.target: Here is a user with two phone numbers and a group with some members.

trans-unit.source: cs1
trans-unit.target: cs1

trans-unit.source: cs2
trans-unit.target: cs2

trans-unit.source: Appendix A
trans-unit.target: Appendix A

trans-unit.source: SQL script to create the sample database
trans-unit.target: SQL script to create the sample database
